sentence.Network_en: He sat on a tapestry cushion next to the hearth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他坐在壁炉边上的一块绣花软垫上。

sentence.Network_en: He stoked up the fire in the hearth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给壁炉里的火添了点柴。

sentence.Network_en: A log fire crackled in the hearth.
sentence.Network_cn: 炉中的木柴烧得噼啪作响。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English heorth, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch haard and German Herd

entry.def: The hearth is the floor of a fireplace, which sometimes extends into the room.

example.ex: It was winter and there was a huge fire roaring in the hearth.
example.tran: 时值冬天，壁炉里炉火熊熊。

entry.def: A person's home and family life can be referred to as their hearth and home .

example.ex: ...a man who leaves his hearth and home to labour as a miner in the inhospitable north.
example.tran: 离开温暖舒适的家到荒凉的北方做矿工的男子

means.word_mean: 1. an open recess in a wall at the base of a chimney where a fire can be built;

sentences.sentence: "the fireplace was so large you could walk inside it"
"he laid a fire in the hearth and lit it"
"the hearth was black with the charcoal of many fires"

means.word_mean: 2. home symbolized as a part of the fireplace;
3. an area near a fireplace (usually paved and extending out into a room);

sentences.sentence: "they sat on the hearth and warmed themselves before the fire"

sentences.en: A bright fire was burning in the hearth.

jushi.english: A log fire roared in the open hearth.
jushi.chinese: 柴火在敞开着的壁炉里熊熊燃烧。
